title: A Brief Overview of our Furry Felines: Cats
body_text:
Title: A Brief Overview of our Furry Felines: Cats 

Cats, also known as Felis catus, play a beloved role in countless households worldwide. These furry companions are valued for their easy maintenance, playful behavior, and often, their aloof charm, making them one of the most popular pet choices next to dogs.  

Cats are a highly diverse species with over 60 recognized breeds, each featuring distinct physical characteristics, temperaments, and health profiles. From the sleek, ebony-coated Oriental Shorthair to the grand, majestic Maine Coon, their diversity is simply astounding. Moreover, each cat, regardless of breed, has its unique personality traits, making them endearing and fascinating pets. 

Unknown to many, cats are essentially crepuscular creatures, meaning they are most active during dawn and dusk. Despite our domestic cats' indoor lifestyle, they retain this instinct from their far-off ancestors who used these times to hunt, avoiding bigger predators active during the day or night. Hence, your cat's sudden midnight sprint isn't random but a regular exercise of these primal instincts.

Cats have also significantly contributed to human well-being. Numerous studies highlight the therapeutic role of cats in reducing stress and anxiety, with their soft purrs and warm cuddles acting as effective natural relaxants. Moreover, owning a cat encourages responsibility in children and provides companionship for individuals of all ages, thereby improving emotional health.

Contrary to popular belief, a cat's purr isn't always a sign of contentment. They also purr when stressed, injured or unwell. Therefore, cat owners need to stay attuned to their pet's behavior, as these subtle signs could indicate potential health issues needing prompt attention.

In conclusion, cats are a fascinating mix of independence and companionship. They are low maintenance compared to other pets and offer unmatchable charm, making them a delightful addition to any family. They, like all pets, require attention and care to ensure they lead a happy, contented life. No wonder they have earned the title as one of man’s favorite domestic companions.
summary:
"Cats are recognized as Felis catus and are popular household pets."
"They are over 60 recognized cat breeds, each unique."
"Cats are most active during dawn and dusk, or crepuscular."
"Cats contribute to human well-being by reducing stress and anxiety."
"Cats purr can indicate contentment, stress, or potential health issues."
"Despite their independence, cats require care and attention for happiness."
<Cats, with distinct personalities, can be endearing and fascinating pets.>
<These furry companions are low maintenance and provide companionship.>
<They often improve emotional health due to their therapeutic role.>
[All cats are born with the ability to speak human languages.]
questions: Cats, with distinct personalities, can be endearing and fascinating pets.
These furry companions are low maintenance and provide companionship.
They often improve emotional health due to their therapeutic role.
All cats are born with the ability to speak human languages.

title: Understanding Man's Best Friend: A Glipse into the World of Dogs
body_text:
Title: Understanding Man's Best Friend: A Glimpse into the World of Dogs

For centuries, dogs have held a special place in our hearts, earning the title of 'Man's Best Friend.' These fascinating creatures not only offer companionship but exhibit an exceptionally diverse range of breeds, each with unique traits and capabilities.

The beginnings of our long-standing relationship with dogs trace back 20,000 to 40,000 years, when they were first domesticated from wild wolves. It's dazzling to consider that all dog breeds, from the tiny Chihuahua to the imposing Great Dane, are descendants of a common ancestor.

One of the most remarkable aspects of dogs is their intelligence. Dogs are able to be trained to perform a wide range of tasks, from basic commands like 'sit' and 'stay' to more complicated tasks like guiding the visually impaired. They even serve as therapy and rescue dogs, showcasing their emotional sensitivity and dedication to their human companions.

Dogs are also known for their loyalty and affection. Studies indicate that dogs not only adore their owners but also perceive them as part of their family. They are able to read our emotions, comfort us in times of distress, and share in our joy. This emotional connection makes dogs truly integral to our lives.

Each dog breed has a unique blend of characteristics, impacting their appearance, temperament, and care needs. For instance, Golden Retrievers are highly sociable and are great with families, while Dalmatians are energetic and require ample exercise. Understanding these traits is vital when choosing the perfect canine companion.

In conclusion, our bond with dogs is etched deep into our history and our hearts. Dogs are more than just pets; they are companions, friends, protectors, emotional support, and a source of unending love and loyalty. Whether they are wagging their tails in sheer joy or comforting us during troubled times, dogs indeed prove that they are man's best friend.
summary:
Dogs have been cherished for centuries for their companionship. 
Our relationship with dogs dates back 20,000 to 40,000 years ago. 
All dog breeds share a common ancestor with wild wolves. 
Dogs can be trained to perform simple to complex tasks. 
<They serve as therapy and rescue dogs demonstrating their sensitivity.> 
Dogs have a deep emotional connection with their human owners. 
<Each dog breed possess different characteristics and care needs.> 
Golden Retrievers are sociable and suitable for families. 
Dalmatians are energetic and need a lot of exercise. 
<Dogs are seen as companions, friends, and emotional support.>
[Dogs evolved from domesticated foxes about 15,000 years ago.]
questions: They serve as therapy and rescue dogs demonstrating their sensitivity.
Each dog breed possess different characteristics and care needs.
Dogs are seen as companions, friends, and emotional support.
Dogs evolved from domesticated foxes about 15,000 years ago.

title: Nautical Wonders: An Exploration of Boats
body_text:
Title: Nautical Wonders: An Exploration of Boats

Boats have been at the heart of civilization's progress, serving as critical modes of transportation, commerce, and leisurely activities for thousands of years. From the dugout canoes of our ancestors to the sophisticated powerboats of today, boats embody human ingenuity and our profound connection to the world's waterways.

One cannot discuss boats without highlighting the diversity in their types and uses. Sailboats, driven by the power of the wind, are widely used for leisure and competitive racing. They offer an environmentally friendly, serene way to traverse the open waters. In contrast, motorboats, equipped with powerful engines, offer speed and are used for a variety of purposes, including fishing and water sports.

Then we have houseboats, which serve as floating residences, offering a unique aquatic lifestyle. Cargo ships, on the other hand, are the backbone of global commerce, transporting goods from one corner of the world to another.

Boats also play an important role in safety and rescue operations. Lifeboats, for instance, are an essential part of marine safety systems, used in evacuation during maritime emergencies.

In recent years, there has been a growing shift towards sustainability in the boating industry. Solar and wind-powered boats are increasingly popular, reflecting the global need for renewable energy sources.

However, boat ownership comes with responsibilities—both environmental and safety-wise. Boat owners are urged to be conscious of their vessels' impact on water ecosystems and marine life and to abide to safety regulations to ensure an enjoyable, safe experience on the water.

In essence, boats strengthen our relationship with the water world. They not only facilitate exploration, commerce, and recreation, but also inspire innovation and respect for our precious water resources. As technology and sustainability continue to shape the future of boating, the value and significance of these nautical wonders will continue to sail high on the waves of evolution.

"Boats like sailboats and motorboats are used for leisure and competitive activities."

title: The Fast Cars of the World
body_text:
In the fast-paced world of automotive advancements, cars have significantly evolved from mere transportation tools to sophisticated and technologically advanced machines. 

Initially, the invention of the car was solely to ease mobility. However, modern car designs, built with aesthetics and performance in mind, embody a blend of art and engineering. Owning cars has moved beyond practicality to also making a statement of personal style and sophistication. 

Modern cars are packed with fascinating features for safety, convenience, and leisure. The availability of options such as self-parking, adaptive cruise control, and advanced infotainment systems in even the base models of certain vehicles underscores the substantial progress cars have made from their original incarnity when Karl Benz patented the first practical car in 1886.

Cars are not only about delivering from point A to B anymore but are becoming an integral part of our digital lives. With highly advanced features like Wi-Fi connectivity, seamless smartphone integration, heads-up displays, and, to a degree, semi- autonomous driving, they offer an unmatched blend of convenience and luxury. 

Today, there is a vast array of car models for every budget, lifestyle, and need. We've seen a recent emergence of electric cars with brands like Tesla spearheading this change. The aim is to create more environmentally-friendly cars without sacrificing the power, speed, or luxury that drivers love. 

However, all this advancement, especially in electric and autonomous vehicles, has raised critical issues about safety, privacy, regulations, and the effect on jobs, which will undoubtedly have significant societal impacts as technology continues to evolve.

In conclusion, cars epitomize how far we have progressed in technology. They symbolize the balance we continually strive to achieve between convenience, efficiency, luxury, and environmental responsibility. There is no doubt that the future of cars is bright and promising, as incorporate more technology to make our drives safer, cleaner, and more enjoyable.

"Cars have evolved from mere transportation tools to technologically advanced machines."
"Modern cars come with features such as self-parking, adaptive cruise control."
<The first practical car was patented by Karl Benz in 1886.>
"Advanced features in cars include Wi-Fi connectivity, smartphone integration, heads-up displays."
<Cars now form an integral part of our digital lives.>

"These advancements may have significant societal impacts as technology continues to evolve."
"Cars symbolize the balance between convenience, efficiency, luxury, and environmental responsibility."
[Henry Ford invented the first electric car.]

title: High-flying Innovations: A Glimpse into the World of Airplanes
body_text:
Title: High-flying Innovations: A Glimpse into the World of Airplanes 

Since the historic flight of the Wright brothers over a century ago, airplanes have revolutionised the way we travel, bridging the geographical divide with incredible speeds and unyielding service. Today, a plane ticket is the passport to worldwide connectivity, whether for leisure, business or emergency travel.

Modern planes are marvels of engineering, where the size alone speaks volumes of the progress in aviation technology. The largest passenger plane currently in the sky, the Airbus A380, constitutes an embodiment of comfort with its vast, state-of-the-art facilities, accommodating over 800 passengers on two full-length decks. 

Yet, size alone doesn't determine the success of aircraft. Speed is a paramount concern. The record-breaking Concorde, for instance, reduced the London-New York flight time by half, traveling at twice the speed of sound. Although grounded in 2003, the Concorde set a precedent for speed in commercial aviation, inspiring visions for a new supersonic era.

Technology is at the forefront of plane evolution. Advancements in materials, from robust metallic alloys to modern composites, have led to lightweight yet strong fuselages, reducing fuel consumption and boosting efficiency. Innovative design and aerodynamics have increased the capacity of airplanes to navigate extreme weather conditions, ensuring safer flights.

However, the future of aviation lies beyond merely improving the existing. Eco-friendly planes propelled by electric or hybrid-electric engines are already undergoing trials, designed to counter mounting environmental concerns. Automation, too, is creeping its way into the cockpit, promising flights that are not only safer but also more efficient.

In conclusion, airplanes have not only shaped the way we travel but have also paved the way for exciting technological innovations. As these flying machines continue to evolve, they stand testament to humankind's unceasing quest for knowledge and progress, defying gravity and exceeding boundaries. So, the next time you buckle up for a flight, remember the remarkable engineering masterpiece that you're aboard.
summary:
Airplanes have revolutionized worldwide travel since the Wright Brothers. 
The Airbus A380, the largest passenger plane, accommodates over 800 passengers.
Concorde set a speed precedent in commercial aviation by halving New York-London flight time. 
<Advancements in materials have led to lightweight, strong fuselages.>

<Automation is being integrated into cockpits for safer, more efficient flights.>

[Airplanes were first invented in the early 1800s.]
questions: Advancements in materials have led to lightweight, strong fuselages.
Automation is being integrated into cockpits for safer, more efficient flights.

title: The Enchanting World of Frogs
body_text:
Title: The Enchanting World of Frogs 

The world of frogs is more fascinating and diverse than many of us realize. Spreading across the globe, frogs inhabit every continent except Antarctica, taking on different forms and living in varied environments from tropical rainforests to arid deserts.

There are over 5,000 frog species, each uniquely adapted to its environment. For instance, the tiny Gold Frog measures merely a centimeter in length, while the enormous Goliath Frog can grow up to 30 centimeters. Some frogs, like the African Bullfrog, can live for up to 45 years, challenging the stereotypes of short-lived amphibians.

Frogs’ skin is what makes them most interesting. It is laced with glands that produce a wide array of chemicals. Some of these chemicals are potent toxins, while others have medicinal properties, providing potential resources for new pharmaceutical developments. The colour of their skin can be vividly beautiful, offering excellent camouflage or warning to predators about their poisonous nature. 

Frogs are also beings of incredible agility. Consider the tree frog - it leaps through the airborne world of the forest canopy, using its suction-cup fingers and toes to stick onto surfaces. And then there's the Poison Dart Frog, a creature capable of shooting poison up to two meters.

Frogs, sadly, are among the most threatened groups of wildlife, with several species reaching near extinction due to habitat loss, pollution, climate change, and a fungal disease rampant in amphibian populations around the globe. Conservation efforts are now critically important to preserve these remarkable creatures for future generations. 

The enchanting world of frogs is intriguing and complex. By studying them, we not only learn interesting facts about their biology and behavior but also about their critical roles in ecosystems. Frogs serve as a reminder of the vast biodiversity our planet holds, emphasizing the importance of protecting it. 

Despite their small size, frogs have a huge impact on the world. Through their survival, they also tell us about the health of our planet, making them worth far more than their weight in gold.
summary:
Frogs are incredibly diverse, inhabiting all continents except Antarctica. 
There are over 5,000 distinct frog species. 
Some frog species, like the African Bullfrog, can live up to 45 years. 
<The skin of frogs produces various chemicals, some with medicinal properties.>
Frogs have excellent agility, for instance, tree frogs use suction-cup fingers to stick onto surfaces. 
<The Poison Dart Frog can shoot poison up to two meters.>
Several frog species are nearing extinction due to numerous threats like habitat loss and climate change. 
<Conservation efforts are critical in preserving frog species for future generations.>
Frogs play crucial roles in ecosystems and signal the health of our planet. 
[All species of frogs have the natural ability to fly.]
questions: The skin of frogs produces various chemicals, some with medicinal properties.
The Poison Dart Frog can shoot poison up to two meters.
Conservation efforts are critical in preserving frog species for future generations.
All species of frogs have the natural ability to fly.

title: The Revolutionizing Impact of Discord in Digital Communication
body_text:
Title: The Revolutionizing Impact of Discord in Digital Communication 

Discord has ingeniously revolutionized digital communication, paving the way for a structured, convenient, and user-friendly interface that caters to gamers and non-gamers alike. Borne from the need for a seamless communication tool for gamers, this innovative platform has gained widespread acceptance, boasting over 250 million users worldwide.

Discord got its origins within the gaming community, providing a solution to fragmented group chats and communication challenges. This platform merges voice, text, and video chat functions, thus developing a communicative ecosystem that extends beyond the gaming realm. Whether to facilitate collaborations amongst professional groups, organize events, or even to just engage in simple chats, Discord serves multifaceted purposes.

The platform stands out for its server creation feature where users can establish a specific topic or interest-focused community. These servers can be made public or invite-only and can be divided into separate channels for different topics or conversations. These features have proven to be invaluable in fostering social engagements and focused discussions.

Moreover, Discord offers options for personalized bots to manage servers. These bots can perform myriad tasks ranging from moderating chats, organizing game nights to scheduling events, making the platform perpetually adaptable to its users' needs.

The success of Discord is simply emblematic of the potential in cross-application utility. Originally designed for gamers, Discord has diversified its application, fulfilling an array of communication needs. It has provided a way for people worldwide to maintain connections, support one another, and ultimately create valuable networks across an open and engaging platform.

In conclusion, Discord has skillfully extended its reach beyond its initial target audience. By acknowledging the intricacies of communication in an increasingly digital world, Discord shows us that with innovation, any platform can transcend its initial purpose and provide immense value in unexpected sectors.

Discord revolutionized digital communication with a user-friendly interface. 
The platform was initially developed to address gamer communication needs.

title: The Power and Impact of The Internet
body_text:
Title: The Power and Impact of The Internet 

The rise of the Internet has ushered in an unprecedented era of connectivity which continues to revolutionize our world, touch every facet of human life and alter our societal fabric in profound ways.

With over 4.6 billion people now online, the Internet has essentially shrunk the world into a global village. The desire for faster and easier communication gave birth to the Internet. Today, it has expanded beyond imagination, fusing the physical and digital spheres, and seeping into every corner of our daily lives, from education to business, healthcare to entertainment.

The Internet is unquestionably, an embodiment of freedom. It is a platform that allows everyone to voice their ideas, interact with a global audience, create, and innovate at will. Internet users can access a wealth of knowledge, learn new skills, bridge cultural gaps, or form virtual communities based on shared interests. 

However, like a double-edged sword, the Internet also harbors risks and challenges. Issues such as cybercrime, privacy violation, online harassment, and digital addiction have surfaced. Tackling them require multinational cooperation, stringent laws, and enhanced digital security measures.

Additionally, the digital divide persists as impoverished and remote areas still lack Internet access, thereby exacerbating inequality. Therefore, there is an urgent call for global initiatives to ensure universal Internet access.

Moreover, the Internet has breathed life into the concept of a digital economy, creating a plethora of opportunities and jobs. Yet, it also demands adaptability, as traditional businesses must digitize or face obsolescence.

Regardless of its challenges, the Internet stands as a testament to human ingenuity and innovation. As we stand on the cusp of more technological advances, like the Internet of Things and 5G, conceivably, the Internet’s potential is just beginning to unfold.

In conclusion, the Internet, while fraught with issues, undeniably broadens horizons, empowers individuals, and drives progress. It is an evolution that shapes and is shaped by society, encouraging us to adapt, evolve, and chase the advent of the future.
summary:
The internet has revolutionized all sectors of human life. 
There are currently over 4.6 billion internet users worldwide. 
The internet allows users to share ideas and form virtual communities. 
<However, the internet also presents risks such as cybercrime and privacy violation.>
<Multinational cooperation is required to tackle these challenges.>
Universal internet access is needed to address the digital divide. 
The internet has created a digital economy, providing numerous job opportunities. 
<Businesses must digitize to adapt to the rise of the digital economy.>
<As technology advances, the potential of the internet continues to grow.>
Despite its challenges, the internet drives societal progress. 
[The internet was originally invented in the 1970s by Bill Gates.]

Multinational cooperation is required to tackle these challenges.

title: King Charles and Queen Camilla Make Grand Entrance at Trooping the Colour amid the Monarch's Cancer Treatment
body_text:
King Charles is riding in style at Trooping the Colour. The monarch, 75, attended the annual public celebration of his birthday on June 15 in London, marking the second Trooping the Colour of his royal reign. The event, featuring a stunning procession of military personnel and a Royal Air Force flypast soaring through the skies over the city, has marked the British monarch's official birthday for over 260 years. It was confirmed on May 30 that King Charles would attend the event amid his cancer treatment with a small change in his participation. Instead of riding on horseback as he did in previous years, the royal took part in the procession seated in a horse-drawn carriage alongside Queen Camilla.

For the ceremony, the King wore the tunic of the Guard of Honour Order made of bearskin with a blue garter sash, in honor of the regiment's color being trooped, with the cypher of his mother and predecessor, Queen Elizabeth, and decorations of Noble Order military and knight garters. King Charles also wore a selection of medals, including Queen Elizabeth’s 1953 Coronation medal, along with the late monarch's jubilee medals from throughout her reign, from the silver to platinum, obtained in 2022. Camilla, meanwhile, wore a pale green silk crepe dress and coat by Anna Valentine and a hat by favored royal designer Philip Treacy. The monarch, who is Colonel-in-Chief of the Grenadier Guards, accessorized her look with her Grenadier Guards military brooch.

Queen Elizabeth switched from participating in the event on horseback to riding in a coach when she was 60, 15 years younger than her heir is now. The history-making monarch, who died in September 2022, last rode during Trooping the Colour in 1986 on her beloved horse Burmese. King Charles first attended Trooping the Colour at age 3 when it celebrated his grandfather, King George VI. For his debut, the future monarch rode in a carriage with his grandmother, Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother, and his aunt, Princess Margaret. His mother, the then-Princess Elizabeth before she acceded to the throne the following year, was riding horseback in the procession.

Last year, King Charles was joined by Prince William, Prince Edward (a first for the Duke of Edinburgh!) and Princess Anne on horseback while other members of the royal family rode in carriages. Members of the royal family again joined King Charles on the big day, including his daughter-in-law Kate Middleton in her first public appearance since announcing her cancer diagnosis in March. The Princess of Wales, 42, shared her plan to attend Trooping the Colour the day prior, writing in a personal message, "I’m looking forward to attending the King’s Birthday Parade this weekend with my family and hope to join a few public engagements over the summer, but equally knowing I am not out of the woods yet."

A Buckingham Palace spokesperson said on June 14, "His Majesty is delighted that the princess is able to attend tomorrow’s events and is much looking forward to all elements of the day." 

The Trooping the Colour festivities began when the procession departed Buckingham Palace, heading down The Mall in London to Horse Guards Parade at St. James’s Park. There, King Charles and other members of the royal family will watch the Irish Guards "troop their colour," or present their flag. King Charles, Queen Camilla, and the rest of the royal family will oversee the ceremony.
summary:
<King Charles attended Trooping the Colour on June 15 in London.>

<The event marked the British monarch's official birthday for over 260 years.>

Trooping the Colour includes a procession of military personnel and an RAF flypast.

King Charles participated in the event from a horse-drawn carriage.

Instead of horseback, he rode with Queen Camilla in the carriage.

<The King wore the tunic of the Guard of Honour Order.>

Camilla wore a pale green silk dress and coat by Anna Valentine.

King Charles wore medals including Queen Elizabeth’s 1953 Coronation medal.

Queen Elizabeth last rode during Trooping the Colour in 1986.

Queen Elizabeth switched to a coach for the event at age 60.

King Charles first attended Trooping the Colour at age 3.

Last year, King Charles was joined by Prince William on horseback.

The Princess of Wales attended despite her recent cancer diagnosis in March.

King Charles began participating in the event with his relatives early in life.

[King Charles delivered a surprise piano performance during Trooping the Colour.]

The festivities began with the procession departing Buckingham Palace.

The event proceeded down The Mall to Horse Guards Parade at St. James’s Park.

King Charles and the royal family watched the Irish Guards present their flag.
questions: King Charles attended Trooping the Colour on June 15 in London.
The event marked the British monarch's official birthday for over 260 years.
The King wore the tunic of the Guard of Honour Order.
King Charles delivered a surprise piano performance during Trooping the Colour.

title: Kate Middleton Makes First Formal Appearance in 6 Months at Trooping the Colour 2024
body_text: Nearly three months after sharing her cancer diagnosis, the Princess of Wales said that she's "making good progress" with chemotherapy, though there are "good days and bad days" amid her health journey. "On those bad days you feel weak, tired and you have to give in to your body resting," Kate wrote on Instagram June 14. "But on the good days, when you feel stronger, you want to make the most of feeling well." She added, "My treatment is ongoing and will be for a few more months. On the days I feel well enough, it is a joy to engage with school life, spend personal time on the things that give me energy and positivity, as well as starting to do a little work from home."

title: Joe Alwyn Breaks Silence on Taylor Swift Breakup: "A Hard Thing to Navigate"
body_text:
Joe Alwyn has broken his silence on the end of his relationship with Taylor Swift, over a year after their breakup. The actor sat down with The Sunday Times Style Magazine ahead of the release of his upcoming film, Yorgos Lanthimos' "Kinds of Kindness," on June 21. During the conversation, Alwyn spoke candidly about his breakup with the global superstar in April 2023. 

While he is the first to address their breakup publicly, Swift's newest album, "The Tortured Poets Department," seemingly addresses it, with songs like "So Long, London" and "The Black Dog." The album title itself resembles a WhatsApp group chat Alwyn has with Andrew Scott and Paul Mescal called "The Tortured Man Club." 

When asked if he had listened to the album, Alwyn didn’t directly answer. Instead, he told the publication, "I would hope that anyone and everyone can empathize and understand the difficulties that come with the end of a long, loving, fully committed relationship of over six and a half years. That is a hard thing to navigate. What is unusual and abnormal in this situation is that, one week later, it’s suddenly in the public domain and the outside world is able to weigh in."

Once the news broke that the two had parted ways, the "Conversations With Friends" star noted that their "very real" experience was suddenly thrown into the "very unreal space" of tabloids, social media, and the press, where it was "dissected, speculated on, pulled out of shape beyond recognition." "And the truth is, to that last point, there is always going to be a gap between what is known and what is said," he explained. "I have made my peace with that."

Swifties have long speculated that Alwyn was the one who wanted to keep their relationship private, and the actor emphasized in his interview with the U.K. publication that they decided that together, and he wanted to continue to keep the more private details to himself. "It was never something to commodify, and I see no reason to change that now," Alwyn said, adding, "Look, this is also a little over a year ago now, and I feel fortunate to be in a really great place in my life — professionally and personally. I feel really good."

Elsewhere in their conversation, the "Harriet" actor opened up about his experience working with Lanthimos for the second time on "Kinds of Kindness," which also stars Emma Stone, a longtime friend of Swift and regular collaborator of the director. The film's star-studded cast also includes Willem Dafoe, Margaret Qualley, Jesse Plemons, and Hunter Schafer, among others. In the project, Alwyn plays a single father who is trying to get his wife (Stone) back from a cult. "Even though Yorgos really goes into dark corners in his work, he keeps a light atmosphere on set. It's the second time I’ve worked with him and with Emily," he said, referring to Stone by her birth name, which she previously told The Hollywood Reporter she would like to go by professionally. "I love them both, and I love working with them, so it felt comfortable."

Following Alwyn and Swift's breakup, the Grammy-winning artist began a very public relationship with Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce. She made her first appearance at a Chiefs football game in September 2023 and attended 12 other games last season, including the Super Bowl, where the Chiefs won for the second year in a row.
summary:
<Joe Alwyn broke his silence on his breakup with Taylor Swift.>

Their relationship ended in April 2023.

<Swift's newest album seemingly addresses their breakup.>

Alwyn and Swift's breakup became public shortly after it happened.

Alwyn emphasized their decision to keep the relationship private.

Alwyn did not confirm if he listened to Swift's new album.

  Alwyn and Lanthimos have collaborated before.

<Alwyn praised the positive working environment with Lanthimos.>

He stars alongside Emma Stone in "Kinds of Kindness."

[Swift is planning to retire from music next year.]
questions: Joe Alwyn broke his silence on his breakup with Taylor Swift.

title: Eight Israeli soldiers killed in southern Gaza, IDF says
body_text:
The Israel Defense Forces announced on Saturday that eight soldiers were killed in southern Gaza in the deadliest attack on Israeli forces in months. Only one of the dead troops was identified by the army. No further information was immediately available. In January, 21 Israeli troops were killed in a single attack by Palestinian militants in Gaza. The deaths will likely fuel calls for a cease-fire and heighten Israeli public anger over ultra-Orthodox exemptions from the military. Months of cease-fire negotiations have failed to find common ground between Israel and Hamas. 

On Wednesday, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that Hamas proposed changes to a U.S.-backed plan, some of which he said were "workable" and some not, without elaborating. Last month, Israel's Supreme Court ordered an end to government subsidies for many ultra-Orthodox men who don't serve in the army. Their exemption from military service has angered large swathes of Israeli society during the eight-month war. Israel's coalition government contains a powerful bloc of ultra-Orthodox parties that have been longtime partners of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

Israel's bombardment and ground offensives in Gaza have killed more than 37,000 Palestinians, according to health officials, who don't give the breakdown of civilians and fighters. The war has also driven about 80% of the population of 2.3 million from their homes, and Israeli restrictions and ongoing fighting have hindered efforts to bring in humanitarian aid, fueling widespread hunger. Israel launched its campaign after Hamas and other militants stormed into Israel on Oct. 7, killing some 1,200 people, mostly civilians, and taking around 250 hostages. Over 100 hostages were released during a weeklong cease-fire last year in exchange for Palestinians imprisoned by Israel. Hamas is believed to be holding around 80 hostages and the remains of another 40.

title: WWE Clash At The Castle 2024 Results: Sami Zayn Beats Chad Gable
body_text:
Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to LinkedIn 

Chad Gable vs. Sami Zayn at WWE Clash at the Castle 2024. Credit: WWE.com

Sami Zayn defeated Chad Gable at WWE Clash at the Castle in a heated match. Zayn was able to win the match with a Helluva Kick after Otis defiantly carried an injured Maxxine Dupri out of the OVO Vanguard Mid-Cap ETF Hydro Arena. A hot crowd in Scotland was fully behind Sami Zayn, chanting for the popular babyface while calling Chad Gable a "wanker." Fans also chanted for Otis as they begged for him to do the right thing and betray his "Master" Chad Gable.

Sami Zayn and Chad Gable arguably had the best feud heading into the five-match WWE Clash at the Castle show. With Gable’s contract reportedly coming due, WWE finally gave the talented star the push he has deserved for years now. Following a red-hot run alongside Jason Jordan as American Alpha in NXT, Gable toiled aimlessly on the main roster. Gable’s lowest moment came when he was made to portray "Shorty G" in 2019 at Vince McMahon’s behest. From there, Gable formed the Alpha Academy, which was essentially the modern-day version of the Social Outcasts. But after Gable offered counsel to Sami Zayn ahead of Sami’s record-breaking win over GUNTHER, Gable was allowed to layer his character, turn heel and suddenly find himself as one of the top heels on the Raw roster.

Otis was at the center of Sami and Chad’s feud, as the precocious Superstar finds himself conflicted between listening to his abusive coach and taking Sami Zayn’s advice by branching out on his own. Gable is taking no prisoners, as Alpha Academy members Maxxine Dupri, Akira Tozawa, and Otis have been held against their will in what is now a cult-like stable.

What made Gable vs. Zayn especially delectable is the uncertainty of who would win. Was Otis going to finally stand up for himself and cost Gable the Intercontinental Championship? Was Otis going to accidentally cost Sami the match in a fit of rage, leading to tension between Zayn and Otis? And at what point will the Creed Brothers get involved as WWE continues to tease Gable recruiting the blue-chip athletes?

In the end, Chad Gable has momentum to give away, even though he did not leave Scotland with the WWE Intercontinental Championship. Everything that Chad Gable has been as a heel, Otis has been the antithesis as a sympathetic babyface. And as Otis charts his path toward revenge against Gable, there’s a good chance this could ultimately end in not only Chad Gable’s first singles title win, but also a star-making Intercontinental Championship win for Otis.

Follow me on Twitter or LinkedIn. Check out my website or some of my other work here. 

Alfred Konuwa

title: Charles Barkley says next season will be his last on TV, no matter what happens with NBA media deals.
body_text:
By The Associated Press

Charles Barkley said Friday that next season will be his last on TV, no matter what happens with the NBA’s media deals. The Hall of Fame player has spent the last 24 years working as a studio analyst for TNT, which could lose the rights to broadcast NBA after next season. But no matter where the games end up, Barkley won’t be following.

“There’s been a lot of noise around our network the last few months and I just want to say I’ve talked to all the other networks, but I ain’t going nowhere other than TNT,” Barkley said while working on NBA TV’s NBA Finals postgame show.

The NBA’s current deals with ABC-ESPN and Turner Sports expire after next season and the league has been talking with NBC, ESPN, and Amazon, among other networks and platforms, about what comes next. Commissioner Adam Silver said last week he hopes new long-term deals will be completed shortly.

Barkley and broadcast teammates Ernie Johnson, Shaquille O’Neal, and Kenny Smith have discussed their uncertain future on their popular “Inside the NBA” studio show. Barkley would seemingly draw interest from any network televising NBA, but the 61-year-old has decided that 25 years will be enough and he will “pass the baton,” hopefully, to a TNT teammate such as Vince Carter or Jamal Crawford.

“But I have made the decision myself no matter what happens, next year is going to be my last year on television,” he said.

___

title: Dallas Mavericks stay alive with 122-84 rout of Boston Celtics in Game 4 of NBA Finals
body_text: DALLAS — Luka Dončić scored 25 of his 29 points in the first half, Kyrie Irving added 21 points, and the Dallas Mavericks emphatically extended their season on Friday night, fending off elimination by beating the Boston Celtics 122-84 in Game 4 of the NBA Finals. The Mavs’ stars were done by the end of the third quarter, with good reason. It was all Dallas from the outset, the Mavs leading by 13 after one quarter, 26 at the half, and by as many as 38 in the third before both sides emptied the benches. The 38-point final margin was the third-biggest ever in an NBA Finals game, behind only the Chicago Bulls beating the Utah Jazz 96-54 in 1998 and the Celtics beating the Los Angeles Lakers 131-92 in 2008. Before Friday, the worst NBA Finals loss for the 17-time champion Celtics was 137-104 to the Lakers in 1984. This was worse. Much worse, at times. Dallas’ biggest lead in the fourth was 48 — the biggest deficit the Celtics have faced all season. The Celtics still lead the series 3-1. Game 5 is Monday in Boston.

<Kyrie Irving added 21 points for the Mavericks>

title: Charles Barkley Announced He’s Retiring From TV After Next Year, Whether TNT Gets An NBA Package Or Not
body_text:
Charles Barkley has been the biggest personality in the NBA media space for the last 24 years, working with the NBA on TNT to make Inside the NBA the best studio show in sports. With the NBA apparently close to a new national TV rights deal with ESPN, NBC, and Amazon, the future of Inside and the entire crew is unclear. However, there is a general sense that Barkley will find himself a new TV home if needed, as he has an out in his contract to leave if TNT loses the NBA. 

After Game 4 of the NBA Finals, Barkley was on the NBATV set in Dallas and announced that he’s not going to any other network. Instead, Barkley revealed he would be retiring after next season, which will be his 25th on television, regardless of whether TNT gets a piece of the package or not. He said, "I just want to say thank you to my entire NBA family. I love you guys. There’s been a lot of noise around our network the last few months, and I just want to say, I talked to all the other networks, but I ain't going nowhere other than TNT. But, I have made the decision myself, no matter what happens, next year is going to be my last year on television. And I just want to say thank you to my NBA family, you guys been great to me, my heart is full with joy and gratitude. But, I’m gonna pass the baton at the end of next year. I hope the NBA stays with TNT, but for me personally, I wanted you to hear it from me. Because I’m not doing anymore interviews. Don't y’all be calling me, nobody calling me. I’m not talking about this again. But I wanted to tell my NBATV and TNT family that I’m not going to another network, but I’m going to pass the baton to Jamal Crawford or Vince Carter or you, Steve [Smith]. But next year I’m gonna just retire after 25 years, and I just wanted to say thank you. And I wanted y’all to hear it from me first."

Now, this wouldn’t be the first time Barkley has announced intentions to retire — he rather famously said he wouldn’t do TV past the age of 60 but is now 61. That said, he certainly seems sincere in this statement. If this is the case, next year will be quite the farewell tour for Chuck and Inside the NBA, as the league will be losing one of its biggest voices and personalities from regular programming. I’d be surprised if Barkley simply rides off into the sunset never to be seen again — and I’m curious to find out how long his “no interviews” stance lasts — but if next year is indeed his last as a regular contributor from weekly NBA television, there will not be a true replacement for him because he is a legitimate 1-of-1. You can bet the other networks will try their best to talk him out of this stance, but if he’s genuinely set on calling it a career in television, he’s a first-ballot Hall of Famer behind that desk just as he was on the court.

title: UK royals unite on palace balcony as Princess of Wales returns to public view after cancer diagnosis
body_text:
LONDON — Britain put on a display of birthday pageantry Saturday for King Charles III, a military parade that marked the Princess of Wales' first public appearance since her cancer diagnosis early this year. The annual event was also a show of stability by the monarchy after months in which both the king and Kate, wife of heir to the throne Prince William, have been sidelined by cancer treatment. In a symbolic display of unity, Charles, Queen Camilla, William, Kate and their children were joined by other members of the royal family on a Buckingham Palace balcony at the end of the King's Birthday Parade. The family waved to the gathered crowd as they watched a flyby of military aircraft to cap ceremonies marking the monarch's official birthday. 

It was the first time Kate has appeared in public since December. She disclosed in March that she was undergoing chemotherapy for an unspecified form of cancer. "I am making good progress, but as anyone going through chemotherapy will know, there are good days and bad days," Kate said in a statement released Friday, adding that she faces "a few more months" of treatment. Kate said she is "not out of the woods yet" and officials stress that Saturday's engagement does not herald a full return to public life.

Huge crowds turn out each June to watch the birthday parade, also known as Trooping the Color, which begins with a procession involving horses, musicians, and hundreds of soldiers in ceremonial uniform from Buckingham Palace. The first public sight of the 42-year-old princess came when she traveled in a horse-drawn carriage from the palace down the grand avenue known as the Mall with her children George, 10, Charlotte, 9, and 6-year-old Louis. Bystanders cheered as they caught a glimpse of Kate, dressed in a white dress by designer Jenny Packham and wearing a wide-brimmed Philip Treacy hat. She watched the ceremony with the children from the window of a building overlooking Horse Guards Parade, a ceremonial parade ground in central London. Louis yawned broadly at one point in the proceedings but mostly watched intently.

Prince William, in military dress uniform, rode on horseback for the ceremony, in which troops parade past the king with their regimental flag, or "color." The display of precision marching and martial music stems from the days when a regiment's flag was an essential rallying point in the fog of battle. Charles, who also is being treated for an undisclosed form of cancer, traveled in a carriage with Queen Camilla, rather than on horseback as he did last year. The king inspected the troops from a dais on the parade ground, saluting as elite regiments of Foot Guards marched past. 

Five regiments take it in turns to parade their color, and this year it was the turn of a company of the Irish Guards, which has Kate as its honorary colonel. The troops in scarlet tunics and bearskin hats were led onto the parade ground by their mascot, an Irish wolfhound named Seamus. Charles, 75, disclosed his cancer in February, and has recently eased back into public duties. He attended commemorations last week for the 80th anniversary of D-Day, the Allied invasion of Nazi-occupied Europe on June 6, 1944.

In one of the many quirks of British royal convention, Saturday is not the king's real birthday — that's in November. Like his mother Queen Elizabeth II before him, Charles has an official birthday on the second Saturday in June. The date was chosen because the weather is generally good.

<Princess of Wales' first appearance since cancer diagnosis happened.>

[Charles executed a tandem parachute jump with the Irish Guards.]

title: Prince George, Charlotte and Louis Are Back on Parade
body_text: Prince William and Princess Kate's three children made their first joint official public appearance of 2024 in London today, as they took part in the annual Trooping the Colour celebrations. Prince George, Princess Charlotte, and Prince Louis appeared in an open carriage as they left Buckingham Palace with their mother, Princess Kate, who was also making her first appearance since her cancer diagnosis earlier this year. Kate and the children have become a highly anticipated feature at the Trooping the Colour event, which marks the official birthday of the monarch each June with a military parade. Kensington Palace confirmed the Wales family's attendance on Friday after growing speculation in Britain about Kate's return to public life.

title: Alex Verdugo homers against the Red Sox, gets booed 'like a Yankee' in return to Fenway Park
body_text: We had to wait more than two months, but the first Boston Red Sox vs. New York Yankees series of 2024 has arrived, and it did not take long for things to get interesting at Fenway Park. In the first inning of Friday night's series opener, Alex Verdugo hit a first-pitch home run against his former team after the crowd greeted him with boos. Here is Verdugo's blast. This is no cheapie. He hit it to dead center field and certainly seemed to enjoy himself rounding the bases. Earlier in the day Friday, Verdugo told reporters he expected to be treated "like a Yankee" by the Fenway Park crowd, and that he was. He heard boos on par with what Aaron Judge and Juan Soto, who doubled earlier in that first inning, heard before their at-bats. Verdugo was a solid player during his four years in Boston, though he was benched multiple times for not hustling. Last season, he was also reprimanded after he showed up late to the ballpark. Earlier this week, he said he enjoyed playing for the Red Sox but wishes they had done more to improve the team at the trade deadline in 2022 and 2023. The Yankees and Red Sox made a rare trade in December that sent Verdugo to New York for three pitching prospects. He took a .259/.314/.418 batting line and eight home runs into Friday's game. Verdugo also rates as one of the league's best defensive left fielders this year. He will be a free agent after the season. At 49-22, the Yankees took baseball's best record into this weekend's series. The Red Sox are in third place in the AL East at 35-34.

title: Crews rescue 30 people trapped upside down on Oregon amusement park ride
body_text: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — Emergency crews in Oregon rescued 30 people Friday after they were stuck for close to half an hour, dangling upside down on a ride at a century-old amusement park. Portland Fire and Rescue said on social media that firefighters worked with engineers at Oaks Park to manually lower the ride. All riders were evacuated and medically evaluated, with no reports of injuries. Video shot by a passenger on a neighboring Ferris wheel shows people sitting upside down on the AtmosFEAR ride. The ride operates like a pendulum, eventually swinging the riders completely upside down. Oaks Park, which first opened in 1905, offers a “uniquely Portland blend of modern thrills and turn-of-the-century charm on a midway that has delighted generations of Northwesterners.”

title: Alex Jones' Personal Assets to Be Sold to Pay $1.5B Sandy Hook Debt. Company Bankruptcy is Dismissed
body_text:
HOUSTON — A federal judge on Friday ordered the liquidation of conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' personal assets but dismissed his company’s separate bankruptcy case, leaving the immediate future of his Infowars media platform uncertain. Jones owes $1.5 billion for his false claims that the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting was a hoax.

Judge Christopher Lopez approved converting Jones’ proposed personal bankruptcy reorganization to a liquidation. However, Lopez dismissed the case of his company, Austin, Texas-based Free Speech Systems, after failed attempts by Jones to reach an agreement with the Sandy Hook families on his proposals to reorganize the company while paying them millions of dollars.

It’s unclear what will happen to Free Speech Systems, Infowars’ parent company, which Jones built into a multimillion-dollar moneymaker over the past 25 years by selling dietary supplements and other products. Both Jones and lawyers for the Sandy Hook families expect Infowars to cease operating at some point because of the huge debt. A trustee appointed Friday in Jones’s personal bankruptcy case will oversee the liquidation and control his assets, including Infowars.

The dismissal of Free Speech Systems’ case means the families can now move to collect on the $1.5 billion in state courts in Texas and Connecticut, where they won defamation lawsuits against Jones and the company. Infowars might continue operating during the collection efforts, which could involve selling off the company’s assets.

Jones, who smiled as the judge dismissed the company’s case, called into Infowars after the court hearing and predicted more battles in state courts. He said, “The bizarre political attempts to hijack the operation have failed," adding that he would find another way to broadcast his shows if he loses Infowars.

Outside the courthouse, he criticized the families for not accepting his reorganization proposals and alleged they were being used by political groups in a conspiracy to silence him. He said he would try to maximize revenues at Infowars to make money for creditors and then wind down the business in a way that takes care of its 44 employees. “This is about taking me off the air,” Jones said. “Understand that what you’ve seen in the corporate media about me has no bearing on reality.”

Chris Mattei, a lawyer for the Sandy Hook families, called Infowars “soon-to-be defunct” as his clients move to collect on the debt in state courts. He said the families would also pursue Jones’ future earnings. “Today is a good day,” Mattei said in a text message after the hearing. “Alex Jones has lost ownership of Infowars, the corrupt business he has used for years to attack the Connecticut families and so many others. Alex Jones is neither a martyr nor a victim. He is the perpetrator of the worst defamation in American history.”

Lopez had been asked to either convert Free Speech Systems’ bankruptcy reorganization to a liquidation or dismiss the case. He said his sole focus was on what would be best for the company and its creditors. He also noted that Free Speech Systems’ case appeared to be one of the longest-running of its kind in the country and was approaching a deadline to resolve it.
summary:

title: Dutch tourist found dead on Greek island, and 4 other foreign tourists are missing on 3 islands
body_text:
ATHENS, Greece — A missing Dutch tourist was found dead early Saturday on the eastern Greek island of Samos, local media reported. This is the latest in a series of cases where tourists in the Greek islands have died or gone missing, often setting out on hikes in extremely hot temperatures. 

Dr. Michael Mosley, a noted British TV anchor and author, was found dead last Sunday on the island of Symi. A coroner concluded that he had died the previous Wednesday, shortly after a hike over difficult, rocky terrain. Samos, like Symi, lies very close to the Turkish coast. The body of the 74-year-old Dutch tourist was discovered by a Fire Service drone in a ravine about 300 meters from where he was last seen on Sunday, walking with difficulty in the heat.

Authorities are still searching for four people reported missing in the past few days. On Friday, two French tourists were reported missing on Sikinos, a secluded Cyclades island in the Aegean Sea with fewer than 400 permanent residents. The two women, aged 73 and 64, had left their respective hotels to meet.

A 70-year-old American tourist was reported missing Thursday on the small island of Mathraki in Greece’s northwest by his host, a Greek-American friend. The tourist was last seen Tuesday at a cafe with two female tourists who have since left the island. Mathraki, with a population of 100, is a heavily wooded island west of the better-known island of Corfu. Strong winds had prevented police and the fire service from reaching the island to search for the missing person as of Saturday afternoon.

On the island of Amorgos, authorities are still searching for a 59-year-old tourist reported missing since Tuesday after a solo hike in hot conditions. U.S. media identified the missing tourist as retired Los Angeles County Deputy Sheriff Albert Calibet of Hermosa Beach, California. Amorgos, the easternmost of the Cyclades islands, is a rocky 47-square-mile island with fewer than 2,000 inhabitants. A couple of years ago, the island had over 100,000 visitors.

Some media commentary has focused on the need to inform tourists of the dangers of hiking in intense heat. Temperatures across Greece on Saturday were more than 18°F lower than on Thursday when they peaked at almost 113°F. They are expected to rise again from Sunday, although not to heat-wave levels. 

Comments are not available on this story.

title: Best Satellite Internet Providers for 2024
body_text:
Satellite internet is currently the one broadband connection type available to people in rural areas across all 50 states. It serves as a solid alternative for those without access to DSL, cable, or fiber internet. Satellite internet involves linking a home internet modem to a satellite in space. While it doesn't match the internet speed capabilities of fiber or cable connections, satellite broadband is essential when internet access is crucial (a fact highlighted by the pandemic). 

Which satellite internet provider is best? Frankly, there aren't many choices for satellite internet. Based on our analysis, Starlink offers the greatest potential, Hughesnet provides the most reliable speeds, and Viasat's new unlimited data plan could be very attractive to customers. Many people in rural America lack adequate internet access. To ensure you’re getting the best broadband experience possible, we've carefully examined available options, considering speeds, pricing, customer service, and overall value to determine the top internet options. Here’s a quick look at how the best satellite internet providers compare.

**Best Satellite Internet Service Providers:**
1. Starlink: Greatest potential
2. Hughesnet: Most reliable speeds
3. Viasat: Attractive unlimited data plan

**How We Test Satellite Internet Providers:**
Internet service providers are numerous and regional. Unlike testing the latest smartphone, laptop, router, or kitchen tool, it’s impractical to personally test every ISP in a given city. Our approach involves researching pricing, availability, and speed information. We draw on our historical ISP data, provider sites, and mapping information from the Federal Communications Commission (FCC). We also input local addresses on provider websites to find specific options for residents. Additionally, we evaluate customer satisfaction using sources like the American Customer Satisfaction Index and J.D. Power.

ISP plans and prices are subject to frequent changes; all information provided is accurate as of publication. We ask three main questions:
1. Does the provider offer reasonably fast internet speeds?
2. Do customers get decent value for what they’re paying?
3. Are customers happy with their service?

The providers that come closest to “yes” on all three are the ones we recommend. For more details, visit our how we test ISPs page.

**How to Choose a Satellite Internet Provider:**
Finding the right ISP for your household is not easy, especially in rural or underserved areas of the U.S. We recommend carefully considering your household's activities to determine the necessary download and upload speeds. With that knowledge, you can find a plan that fits your budget and broadband demands. For more tips, check out CNET's 10 tips to help you get the most out of your internet service.

What's next ...

title: Trump's Michigan trip will include stops at a Black church and a gathering of far-right activists.
body_text:
DETROIT (AP) — Donald Trump will use back-to-back stops Saturday to court Black voters and a conservative group that has been accused of attracting white supremacists as he works to stitch together a coalition of divergent interests in battleground Michigan. Trump is scheduled to host an afternoon roundtable at an African American church in downtown Detroit. Later, he will appear at the “People’s Convention” of Turning Point Action, a group that the Anti-Defamation League says has been linked to extremists.

Just 24 hours before Trump planned to address the conference, white supremacist Nick Fuentes entered Turning Point’s convention hall surrounded by cheering supporters. He was quickly escorted out by security. Fuentes created political problems for Trump after attending a private lunch with Trump and the rapper Kanye West at Trump’s Florida estate in 2022.

Trump’s weekend plans underscore the evolving political forces shaping the presidential election this fall as he tries to deny Democratic President Joe Biden a second term. Few states are expected to matter more in November than Michigan, which Biden carried by less than 3 percentage points four years ago. And few voting groups matter more to Democrats than African Americans, who made up the backbone of Biden’s political base in 2020. But now, less than five months before Election Day, Black voters are showing signs of disappointment with Biden.

Michael Whatley, the new chairman of the Republican National Committee, told Michigan Republicans at a dinner Friday that the state could not be more important. “Everybody knows if we don’t win Michigan, we’re not going to have a Republican in the White House,” Whatley said. “Let me be more blunt: If we don’t win Michigan, we’re not going to have Donald Trump in the White House.” He added, “We are going to determine the fate of the world in this election in November.”

Trump argues he can pull in more Black voters due to his economic and border security message, and that his felony indictments make him more relatable. Democrats are offering a competing perspective. “Donald Trump is so dangerous for Michigan and dangerous for America and dangerous for Black people,” Michigan Lt. Gov. Garlin Gilchrist II, who is African American, said Friday. He said it was “offensive” for Trump to come.

Among Black adults, Biden’s approval has dropped from 94% when he started his term in January 2021 to just 55%, according to an Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research poll published in March. About 8 in 10 Black voters have an unfavorable opinion of Trump, with roughly two-thirds saying they have a “very unfavorable” view of him, according to an AP-NORC poll conducted in June. About 2 in 10 Black voters have a very or somewhat favorable view of Trump. Trump won 8% of the Black vote in 2020, according to AP VoteCast. And in what is expected to be a close election, even a modest shift could be consequential.

Maurice Morrison, a 67-year-old lifelong Detroit resident, plans to attend Trump’s church appearance. Morrison acknowledged that Trump, for whom he voted twice before and plans to again, is deeply unpopular in his community and even inside his home. “Once he decided to run for president as a Republican, that automatically made him racist. That’s his middle name now — ‘Trump is racist’ — even though he’s not,” he said.

title: U.S. Open: Ludvig Aberg seizes lead; Patrick Cantlay and 2 others are 1 stroke behind
body_text:
By DOUG FERGUSON AP Golf Writer

PINEHURST, N.C. — The U.S. Open is a new experience for Ludvig Aberg, though his machine-like game helped him take the 36-hole lead on Friday. Pinehurst No. 2, however, is not new to him. Aberg, then a 19-year-old from Sweden, was about to start his college career at Texas Tech when he played in the 2019 U.S. Amateur at Pinehurst, losing in the second round.

“I remember it was one of my first experiences playing on a really challenging golf course in America,” Aberg said. “And I thought, ‘Is this what golf in America is like?’ Luckily, it's not like this every week. But I remember it being very hard.”

The course remains tough, and Aberg demonstrated that he is up to the challenge. He didn’t miss a fairway until the eighth hole of the second round. While not immune to mistakes, he avoided big blunders, working his way to a 1-under-par 69 in extreme heat. Heading into the weekend, he led by one shot, with Bryson DeChambeau, Patrick Cantlay, and Rory McIlroy in close pursuit. Scottie Scheffler was just relieved to make the cut and get another shot at Pinehurst.

“The first time I’ve played with him, the guy is like a machine from what I saw,” Tony Finau said after a 69 left him two shots behind. “He hit a lot of fairways and greens. He sure makes it look pretty easy.”

Aberg had a few missteps, missing two fairways and recording two bogeys. He finished the day at 5-under 135, one shot ahead of DeChambeau (69), Cantlay (71), and Thomas Detry of Belgium (67).

Pinehurst No. 2 was challenging not only because of the course layout but also due to a heat index nearing 100 degrees and occasional wind causing doubt. That’s just how the 24-year-old Swede likes it. 

“It’s not an easy course to play,” Aberg said. “But we stayed disciplined, patient, and aimed for our targets. We set out to see how many good shots we could hit today, and it worked out.”

A little over a year since graduating from Texas Tech, Aberg is already ranked No. 6 in the world, has won on both sides of the Atlantic, played in a Ryder Cup, and was runner-up in the Masters.

Scheffler, coming off his fifth victory of the year last week at the Memorial, went birdie-free for the first time in nearly two years. After a double bogey, he thought he was headed home following a 74, but a 5-over 145 made the cut. 

Tiger Woods missed a crucial 12-foot par putt on the 16th hole, ending his chances. He shot 73 and missed the cut by two.

DeChambeau relied more on his putting rather than power and will be in the final group with Aberg. Nine of his last ten rounds in majors have seen him in the top ten on the leaderboard. Despite a fluctuating performance, DeChambeau finished strong with a tap-in birdie on the 18th.

“All in all, I was very happy with how I stayed patient and gave myself good opportunities,” DeChambeau said.

title: Celtics take season's worth of lessons into Game 5 of NBA Finals with latest chance to secure title
body_text:
BOSTON (AP) — The Celtics picked the most inopportune time to play their worst game of the season. Boston’s 122-84 Game 4 loss to Dallas had all kinds of superlatives, and none of them were good. It ended the Celtics’ 10-game playoff win streak. It was the Celtics’ lowest scoring output of the season and marked the first time the Celtics have allowed the Mavericks to eclipse 100 points in the series on a stellar night for Dallas stars Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving. It also reminded the Celtics that putting a championship bow on what has been one of the franchise’s most successful seasons will require the same resilience they’ve shown during a postseason in which they haven’t lost consecutive games. 

"It’s a learning lesson, for sure. Got to show up and show out every night. They’re not going to roll over,” Celtics reserve Sam Hauser said. “They’re down 3-1 now. They’re desperate... They’re not going to make it easy on us.”

As humbling as Game 4’s loss was, history will be on the Celtics’ side for Game 5. While Friday’s loss was the seventh time that the Celtics have lost by 20 or more points in the finals, they are 5-1 in the previous six. The game Monday also falls on the 16th anniversary of Boston clinching its last championship in 2008.

“It’s a great opportunity to respond,” said Celtics forward Jaylen Brown, who finished Game 4 with a minus-19 plus-minus – his second-worst of these playoffs and third-worst of his entire playoff career. “We just regroup. We keep our same mentality, and we come out and get ready to fight in another battle on our home floor.” 

It’s also the latest chance for coach Joe Mazzulla to reinforce the lessons he has tried to instill in the team. Hauser recalled Boston’s Game 3 win when Dallas rallied to cut a 21-point fourth quarter lead to just one with less than four minutes to play. 

“The Mavs were on that big run at the start of the fourth there. He came in and said, ‘That was great. That makes us hungrier,’” Hauser said. “He didn’t even focus on the win, he focused on that, which was cool. It keeps all of us grounded and knowing that we have more work to do.”

It was the same tone Mazzulla tried to set during the regular season. Boston opened the season by winning its first five games before losing in overtime at Minnesota. Postgame, Mazzulla expressed excitement for his team experiencing an opponent challenging it to play its best basketball. Following another loss two nights later at Philadelphia, the Celtics reeled off six straight victories. 

In February, the Celtics lost on their home court to a Los Angeles Lakers team without both LeBron James and Anthony Davis. Then Boston reeled off a season-high 11-game win streak. The Celtics are now just one more bounce-back win away from seeing those instances of adversity bear championship fruit. If they need any more consolation — each of the Celtics' previous three title-winning teams in 1984, 1986, and 2008 all lost with close-out opportunities on the road and then returned to win at home.

“Close-out games are hard. Close-out games are tough,” Brown said. “They always have been like that, and you’ve got to have extreme focus. You’ve got to come out and meet their intensity to finish things out.” 

Jayson Tatum is expecting the TD Garden crowd to bring the energy to match the moment. “I think it’s going to be as loud as it’s ever been in my seven years of being a Celtic,” he said. “Excited to go back home. Celebrate Father’s Day on Sunday and compete for a championship.”

title: Muslim pilgrims converge at Mount Arafat for daylong worship as Hajj reaches its peak
body_text:
MOUNT ARAFAT, Saudi Arabia (AP) — Following the footsteps of prophets beneath a burning sun, Muslims from around the world congregated Saturday at a sacred hill in Saudi Arabia for intense, daylong worship and reflection. The ritual at Mount Arafat, known as the hill of mercy, is considered the peak of the Hajj pilgrimage. It is often the most memorable for pilgrims, who stand shoulder to shoulder, feet to feet, asking God for mercy, blessings, prosperity, and good health. The mount is about 20 kilometers (12 miles) southeast of Mecca. It’s believed that Prophet Muhammad delivered his final speech, known as the Farewell Sermon, at the sacred mount 1,435 years ago. In the sermon, the prophet called for equality and unity among Muslims.

“It’s indescribable,” Ahmed Tukeyia, an Egyptian pilgrim, said on his arrival Friday evening at a tent camp at the foot of Mount Arafat. Hajj is one of the largest religious gatherings on earth. The rituals officially started Friday when pilgrims moved from Mecca’s Grand Mosque to Mina, a desert plain just outside the city. Saudi authorities expect the number of pilgrims this year to exceed 2 million, approaching pre-coronavirus pandemic levels. The pilgrimage is one of the Five Pillars of Islam. All Muslims are required to make the five-day Hajj at least once in their lives if they are physically and financially able to make the demanding pilgrimage.

The rituals largely commemorate the Quran’s accounts of Prophet Ibrahim, his son Prophet Ismail, and Ismail’s mother Hajar — or Abraham and Ismael as they are named in the Bible. This year’s Hajj came against the backdrop of the raging war in the Gaza Strip between Israel and Hamas, which pushed the Middle East to the brink of a regional war between Israel and its allies on one side and Iran-backed militant groups on the other. Palestinians in the coastal enclave of Gaza were not able to travel to Mecca for Hajj this year because of the closure of the Rafah crossing in May, when Israel extended its ground offensive to the strip’s southern city of Rafah on the border with Egypt.

Staving off potential protests or chants about the war during the Hajj, Saudi authorities said they won’t tolerate politicizing the pilgrimage. The time of year when the Hajj takes place varies, given that it is set for five days in the second week of Dhu al-Hijjah, the last month in the Islamic lunar calendar. Most of the Hajj rituals are held outdoors with little if any shade. When it falls in the summer months, temperatures can soar to over 40 Celsius (104 Fahrenheit). The Health Ministry has cautioned that temperatures at the holy sites could reach 48 C (118 F). It urged pilgrims to use umbrellas and drink more water to stay hydrated.

After Saturday’s worship in Arafat, pilgrims will travel a few kilometers (miles) to a site known as Muzdalifa to collect pebbles that they will use in the symbolic stoning of pillars representing the devil back in Mina. Pilgrims then return to Mina for three days, coinciding with the festive Eid al-Adha holiday, when financially able Muslims around the world slaughter livestock and distribute the meat to poor people. Afterward, they return to Mecca for a final circumambulation, known as Farewell Tawaf. Once the Hajj is over, men are expected to shave their heads, and women to snip a lock of hair in a sign of renewal. Most of the pilgrims then leave Mecca for the city of Medina, some 340 kilometers (210 miles) away, to pray in Prophet Muhammad’s tomb.
summary:

title: South Africa's President Ramaphosa is reelected for a second term after a dramatic late coalition deal
body_text: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — South African President Cyril Ramaphosa was reelected by lawmakers for a second term on Friday, after his party struck a dramatic late coalition deal with a former political foe just hours before the vote. Ramaphosa, the leader of the African National Congress, won convincingly in Parliament against a surprise candidate who was also nominated - Julius Malema of the far-left Economic Freedom Fighters. Ramaphosa received 283 votes to Malema’s 44 in the 400-member house. The 71-year-old Ramaphosa secured his second term with the help of lawmakers from the country’s second-biggest party, the Democratic Alliance, and some smaller parties. They backed him in the vote and got him over the finish line following the ANC’s loss of its long-held majority in a landmark election two weeks ago that reduced it to 159 seats in Parliament. During a break in what turned out to be a marathon parliamentary session, the ANC signed the last-minute agreement with the DA, effectively ensuring Ramaphosa stays on as the leader of Africa’s most industrialized economy. The parties will now co-govern South Africa in its first national coalition where no party has a majority in Parliament. The deal, referred to as a government of national unity, brings the ANC together with the DA, a white-led party that had for years been the main opposition and the fiercest critic of the ANC. At least two other smaller parties also joined the agreement. Ramaphosa called the deal - which sent South Africa into uncharted waters - a “new birth, a new era for our country” and said it was time for parties “to overcome their differences and to work together.” “This is what we shall do and this is what I am committed to achieving as the president,” he said. The ANC - the famed party of Nelson Mandela - had ruled South Africa with a comfortable majority since the end of the apartheid system of white minority rule in 1994. But it lost its 30-year majority in the humbling national election on May 29, a turning point for the country. The vote was held against the backdrop of widespread discontent from South Africans over high levels of poverty, inequality, and unemployment. Analysts warn there might be complications ahead, though, given the starkly different ideologies of the ANC, a former liberation movement, and the centrist, business-friendly DA, which won 21% of the vote in the national election, the second-largest share behind the ANC’s 40%. For one, the DA disagreed with the ANC government’s move to accuse Israel of genocide in Gaza in a highly sensitive case at the United Nations’ top court. DA leader John Steenhuisen was the first to confirm the agreement. “From today, the DA will co-govern the Republic of South Africa in a spirit of unity and collaboration,” he said as he stepped away from Friday’s proceedings for a speech carried live on television in which he said a deal was signed and that the DA lawmakers would vote for Ramaphosa for president. The Parliament session started at 10 a.m. in the unusual setting of a conference center near Cape Town’s waterfront, after the city’s historic National Assembly building was gutted in a fire in 2022. The house first went through the hours-long swearing-in of hundreds of new lawmakers and electing a speaker and a deputy speaker. The vote for the president started late at night, with the results announced well after 10 p.m. Ramaphosa finished his acceptance speech as the clock ticked past midnight and into Saturday.

[Ramaphosa was impeached immediately after being reelected.]
